div.div:
LidarLiteSensor controls a single laser distance sensor. It must be paired by LidarLiteBank. Once paired, it configures its sensor, and then reads the current height value at regular intervals.
Key features:
1. Automatically detects disconnection (i.e. sensor lost power)
2. Minimal I2C bandwidth (once configured, just a 5-byte message every time the timer rings).
From reading the datasheet, it appears 100Hz is a good read frequency, so the read timer is set at 10ms.
- This has the added advantage that 10ms is less than the sensor startup time, so if a device goes down we're almost guaranteed to detect it before it comes back up. This makes the pairing process more efficient and less error-prone. (In particular, it's hard to enter the AddressConflict state accidentally)
- The LidarLite sensor is also configured to use a 10ms timer between readings. This timer does NOT account for time spent taking a reading though, so the actual update rate will be slighly less than 100Hz.
Future features:
- Could add some signaling between LidarLiteBank and LidarLiteV3 about when to measure. This would allow spreading the load, decreasing the max cycle time of the LidarLite control logic.
